intro: Tovomitopsis micrantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tovomitopsis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
